citation.article-title: Description of Roseateles aquatilis sp. nov. and Roseateles terrae sp. nov., in the class Betaproteobacteria, and emended description of the genus Roseateles.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Roseateles aquatilis sp. nov.
Roseateles aquatilis (a.qua.ti′lis. L. masc. adj. aquatilis aquatic, growing in water).
Colonies are 4–6 mm in diameter, clear white, circular and umbonate, with an undulate margin and translucent.
Growth occurs in R2A medium at 20–30 °C, but not at 10 or 45 °C.
Cells are rod-shaped (2 μm in length and 0.5 μm in width) with single polar flagella.
Nitrate reduction, indole formation, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, β-galactosidase (PNPG) and aesculin tests are negative.
d-Glucose, maltose, gluconate and malic acid are assimilated.
l-Arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, capric acid, adipic acid, citrate and phenylacetic acid are not assimilated.
The type strain, CCUG 48205T (=CECT 7248T), was isolated from industrial water in Sweden.
